definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards

sentences.english: The crowd was disappointed about the lack of enthusiam from the players.
sentences.chinese: 一些缺乏激情的選手們令觀衆大失所望。

sentences.english: But Miller disappointed many by winning only two silvers, in the giant slalom and the combined, which features one downhill run and one slalom run.
sentences.chinese: 結果，米勒只得到兩面銀牌，令許多人大失所望。

sentences.english: She stood at the corner of Main Street and Washington Avenue and despaired.
sentences.chinese: 她站立在大街和華盛頓路交叉的街角上，大失所望。

sentences.english: Rudd earlier this year, to the dismay of the Labor Party faithful.
sentences.chinese: 陸克文擱置該計劃令工黨的忠實支持者大失所望。

sentences.english: The party was a big let-down.
sentences.chinese: 這個聚會令人大失所望。

sentences.english: If the king had hoped for peace, he was to be sadly disillusioned.
sentences.chinese: 如果國王對和平抱有希望的話，他註定會大失所望。

sentences.english: Here even the best guide-book fails us.
sentences.chinese: 這裏即使最好的旅遊指南書也令我們大失所望。

sentences.english: The British embassy really let them and the vulnerable children down.
sentences.chinese: 英國大使館真讓這些家長和脆弱的孩子們大失所望。

definition: not expected at the outset (idiom)/unforeseen/to be surprised by the turn of events
to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
to have a whole new level of respect for sb or sth/to sit up and take notice (of sb's improved performance etc)
to be unable to make any sense of the matter/to be at a loss
to be pleased beyond one's expectations (idiom)/overjoyed at the turn of events
